snippet: Zoos are trying to mate captive cheetahs and many other animals as so-called insurance populations before their situation in the wild becomes untenable.
abstract: Zoos are trying to mate captive cheetahs and about 160 other endangered species as so-called insurance populations before their situation in the wild becomes untenable; 83 percent of those species in North American zoos are not meeting the targets set for maintaining their genetic diversity (Series: The Animal Lifeboat).
lead_paragraph: Zoos are trying to mate captive cheetahs and many other animals as so-called insurance populations before their situation in the wild becomes untenable.

headline.seo: Matchmaking at Zoos Is Rising for Threatened Species
headline.main: Date Night at the Zoo, if Rare Species Play Along
headline.print_headline: Date Night at the Zoo, if Rare Species Play Along
